entry.title: Data session API
entry.content:
LINE Planet provides data session for an application to communicate application data.
For example, an application sends or receives text message to implement text chatting during a conference.
Note that data session is only available after a call setup is completed or join in a conference.

Application must define data communication protocol and LINE Planet just provides data session(s) as a communication channel for application’s data communication protocol.

LINE Planet is a real time communication platform.
And the real time communication on the internet is not guaranteed because packets could be lost or delayed depends on current network condition. These network impairments affect real time communication quality. Even sometimes the call(or conference) cannot be continued.
Also heavy traffic could cause various network impairments.
When an application uses data session, please perceive data communication makes lower voice communication or video communication quality .

Supported service type Minimum SDK version
1:1 call, group call PlanetKit 3.2 for iOS, macOS and Android
PlanetKit 3.3 for Windows
WebPlanetKit NOT Supported

Data session APIs

An API signature describing this page is different with the real code’s. Please refer API reference documents or codes in implementation.

Data session apis are directional - Send and Receive. For each side, application should request a data session with pre-defined stream id. The ‘pre-defined’ means the stream id value is discussed between the both side before implementation stage.

About Stream ID

A stream id is an identifier of data communication defined by application in a design stage. This is not dynamic. If A receiver cannot handle a specific stream id, must stop to use it.

Available Stream ID Range: 100 ~ 1000

Application must choose stream ids within above available stream id range.

Requesting both sides for the one stream id is available.

API Summary

Related APIs(including event callbacks) are following:

Sender side  
makeSendDataSession Make one data session for a stream id
dataSessionSend Send data
dataSessionChangeDestination Change destination
isSupportedDataSession Check data session compatibility in 1:1 call
Receiver side  
evtDataSessionIncoming New data has arrived through a data session mapped a stream id
makeRecvDataSession Make one data session to receive
unsupportDataSession Un-support the stream id

Data session lifetime

Once a data sessions is made, it is active until the call(or conference) session is ended.

Data session streaming type

Data session has 3 streaming types. Application should choose which type to use depends on application data characteristics.

Type Description
Reliable message Lost packets will be retransmitted.
evtDataSessionRecved is called when every one message is aggregated. So it is called as dataSessionSend calling times.
Reliable bytes Lost packets will be retransmitted.
SDK fragments data if the data is larger than MTU. However will not aggregate packets on the receiver side. Application should aggregate fragmented packets.
UnReliable bytes Lost packets are not retransmitted.
SDK only fragments data such as ‘Reliable byte’.

APIs

Sender side

makeSendDataSession(streamId, type, cbException ,completion…)
Request the new data session to send belong to streamId
@streamId: stream identifier defined by application
@type: data streaming type
@cbException(streamId, exceptionType, …): Called when exception occur
@completion(streamId, …): Completion callback. Application must use the stream id after this completion.

Following table shows the sender side exception list. Please refer and do proper actions on the application layer. Note that too much traffic could lower the audio and video communication quality.

Type Description
Direction		 Application should do
TooLong
QueuedData
(Triggered=TRUE)		 Detected that the data traffic is too much Application should stop or lower send bitrate
TooLong
QueuedData
(Triggered=FALSE)		 Network condition is being better before Available more send traffic
UnspportedDataSessionStreamId Released when unsupportDataSession is called on the receiver side Do not use that stream id

Please note that the more TooLongQueuedData event would the lower voice and video quality.


dataSessionSend(streamId, …)
Send data
@streamId: stream id


dataSessionChangeDestination(streamId, userId, completion, …)
Change destination. Default means broadcast.
@streamId: stream id
@userId: user id. Null means broadcast.
@completion: Completion callback. Changed destination will be applied after this callback.


Receiver side

evtDataSessionIncoming (streamId, …)
When arrive a new data via the data session that had have made and sent by the sender side, a receiver side is notified by evtDataSessionIncoming.
@streamId: streamId in requestSendDataSession() called by the sender

In a conference,
late joiners will also receive evtDataSessionIncoming when receiving the data after join flow completion.

The late joiner means who joins after someone has already started a data stream

makeRecvDataSession(streamId, cbRecved, cbException, completion, …)
Request the new data session to receive belong to streamId
@streamId: stream identifier defined by application. evtDataSessionIncoming delivers this from peer’s streamId in requestSendDataSession
@cbRecved(streamId, data, …) : Received data callback
@cbException(streamId, exceptionType, …): Called shen exception occur
@completion(streamId, …): Completion callback. cbRecved is called after this completion.


unsupportDataSession(streamId, …)
Call this when an application receive unknown streamId in evtDataSessionIncoming. This function lets sender stop to send.
@streamId: stream identifier defined by application. evtDataSessionIncoming delivers this from peer’s streamId in addSendDataSession()


Data session compatibility

  • 1:1 call
    • isSupportedDataSession() provides whether if the peer supports data session or not.
  • Group call
    • Participant info describes whether if a participant supports data session or not

Even the peer(s) has data session capability, capability of handling a specific stream id is another compatibility issue. This issue is about handling of a not implemented stream id old versions.

Compatibility pre-check of specific stream id could be solved by calling rejectRecvDataSession(). Or implement reliable stream id data session that is available from the first version.

History

2021-03-09 The first version
entry.summary: LINE Planet provides data session for an application to communicate application data. For example, an application sends or receives text message to implement text chatting during a conference. Note that data session is only available after a call setup is completed or join in a conference.

entry.title: Shared contents API
entry.content:
Contents share api lets an application share time related data with peers. The shared data could be anything but 1KBytes limited size.

Supported service type Minimum SDK version
1:1 call, group call PlanetKit 3.2 for iOS, macOS and Android
PlanetKit 3.3 for Windows
WebPlanetKit NOT Supported

Contents share API

Function Counterpart event Description
setSharedContents(Data)
setExclusiveSharedContents(Data)		 evtPeerSetSharedContents
evtPeerSetExclusiveSharedContents		 Write shared-data as a specific value
unsetSharedContents(Data)
unsetExclusiveSharedContents(Data)		 evtPeerUnsetSharedContents
evtPeerUnsetExclusiveSharedContents		 Clean the shared-data

Above contents share apis are available only after a call setup is completed - both 1:1 call and group call.

Once someone starts to share data via setSharedContents(), others are notified by evtPeerSetSharedContents that delivers following:

Field Description
user-id Application user id
service-id Application service id
application-data and data-length Data itself and size
elapsed-ms-from-last-set elapsed millisecond time from the shared data is modified

elapsed-ms-from-last-set field lets an application calculate how long time passed from the last modified time.

Please note that only setExclusiveSharedContents() caller can modify the shared data.

The prefix “Exclusive” means the shared data exists only one instance during the room (or the call).
If one shared data is required for all in the room, use the exclusive API pair. Or if all participants require its own data to be shared, use the un-exclusive API pair.

Using both exclusive API and un-exclusive API does not cause any problem.

Example - raise hands before talking

This is a very simple case to show the usage of the contents share apis.
We hope to understand what the ‘Exclusive` is and how to design shared data structure by this example.

An application plans to implement ‘raise hands’ before someone talks by using contents share apis.
And the flag saying ‘raise hands’ is valid only 3 seconds.

The first case assumes anyone can raise hands at one time, so multiple participants can raise hands.

1) Shared data structure ={flag}.
2) Anyone who want to talk, call setSharedContents(flag=TRUE)
3) Everyone knows who want to talk via user-id in evtPeerSetSharedContents.
4) When a new participant joins 4 seconds later, he(or she) will be notified evtPeerSetSharedContentss. And only participants belong to elapsed-ms-from-last-set < 3000 msec are handled as ‘raise hands’.

The second case assumes only one talker can raise hands at one time, so only one participant can raise hands.
This case requires a master participant and just assume user-m is the user-id of the master.

1) Shared data structure ={h-user-id, flag}.
2) Master calls setExclusiveSharedContents(h-user-id=NULL, flag=FALSE).

Here after, others calling setExclusiveSharedContents() is ignored.

3) Anyone who want to talk, call sendShortData() to user-m.
4) Master picks only one participant(assume user-a).
5) Master calls setExclusiveSharedContents(h-user-id=user-a, flag=TRUE).
6) Everyone knows user-a(h-user-id) want to talk(flag=TRUE) via evtPeerSetExclusiveSharedContents.

In the step 6, the caller user-id in evtPeerSetExclusiveSharedContents is the user-m and this is different someone who raises hands.

History

2021-03-09 The first version
entry.summary: Contents share api lets an application share time related data with peers. The shared data could be anything but 1KBytes limited size.

entry.title: Terminology
entry.content:
LINE Planet

VoIP platform name. Often LINE Planet is called as LINE Planet cloud.
Sometimes this means LINE Planet developers or the team.

Application

A client application and server application that uses LINE Planet cloud.
Sometimes this means service developers or a team.

SLA

Service Layer Agreement.
An application requires SLA key to integration LINE Planet.

PlanetKit

Client SDK to access LINE Planet servers.
Integrating LINE Planet means integrating PlanetKit.

Caller, Initiator

Terminal device who makes a new call or end user(human).

Callee, Responder

Counterpart of the caller. Caller may want to call with a Callee.

AppClient

Client application integrating PlanetKit SDK.

AppServer

Server application that has connectivity to LINE Planet server.

Session

A call identification.

Service ID

Planet can identify services with Service ID.
All application must define its own Service ID with below acceptable character set.
     letters[a-zA-Z], digits[0-9], hyphens(“-“) and periods(“.”)
    length limitation: 64 bytes

User ID

The service subscriber identification. All User IDs belong to one Service ID must be unique.
The User ID accepted by LINE Planet must be defined by below character set.
     letters[a-zA-Z], digits[0-9], hyphens(“-“) and underscores(“_”)
    length limitation: 64 bytes

Room ID

Group call instance identification. Application must join with the same room id to communication each other.
The accepted character set is same with the above User ID.

Cellular network

Mobile network. For example 2G, 3G, 4G or 5G.

Cellular call

General phone call through mobile network.

PlanetKit call, LINE Planet call

VoIP call through PlanetKit. This call may use Wifi network or data of mobile network.
The data plan that is subscribing by user could affect the PlanetKit call quality.

Confernce, Group call and room

We don’t distinguish above 3 words. When 3 or more users hope to communicate, they can hold conferenc or group call. And creating a conference or group call means that a room is creating.

evt prefix, Event and Event parameters

Event means a notification from PlanetKit to an application. In the generality of cases, two events are involved when an application calls one PlanetKit API - a local event and a remote event. The local event reports the result of the called PlanetKit API, and the remote event informs triggering something by a peer.
Event parameters are related data generated by PlanetKit when a event has occured.
entry.summary: LINE Planet VoIP platform name. Often LINE Planet is called as LINE Planet cloud. Sometimes this means LINE Planet developers or the team.

entry.title: Client Disconnect Reason - kitDisconnectReason
entry.content:
PlanetKit provides kitDisconnectReason for an application to get to know the call disconnection reason.

The application could react such as showing a message depends on the following reason codes.

The “1:1 Call” column means this can be shown when a 1:1 call is disconnected.

The “Conference” column means this can be shown when a user leaves from a conference call.

“Initiator” means a caller and “Responder” means a callee in 1:1 call.

Normal scenario

Reason 1:1 Call Conference Description
Normal Y Y Disconnected the call without exceptions
Cancel Y N Initiator disconnects the call before the responder answers
Busy Y N Responder is calling
NoAnswer Y N Responder doesn’t answer. Initiator waits for the answer for 60 seconds.
Decline Y Y 1:1 Call: Responder rejects a call
Conference: The old joined conference is declined when join to the same conference room.
(ex. Re-join after crash)
MultiDevInUse Y Y The same id pair(user-id and service-id) is calling in another device
MultiDevAnswer Y N Responder using the same id pair(user-id and service-id) answered for the call in another device
MultiDevDecline Y N Responder using the same id pair(user-id and service-id) declined for the call in another device
AlreadyGotACall Y Y The initiator or the participant already has a incoming call but not received push yet

Exception cases - Terminal

The following reasons are generated on a terminal such as local network environment, device status or PlanetKit internal.

Reason 1:1 Call Conference Description
AudioTxNoSrc Y Y Audio source (i.e mic) has not sent any audio data for a while
NetworkUnavailable Y Y Network is unavailable to keep a call.
Please refer NetworkUnavailableEvent
InternalError Y Y PlanetKit disconnected the call because of internal error
CellCall Y Y Received cellular call during the PlanetKit call
NoPermission Y Y (Only WebPlanetKit case. from 3.1.6)
User doesn’t have permission to use device(microphone, camera)

Exception cases - LINE Planet Server

The following reasons are generated within LINE Planet server cloud. “LINE Planet GW” means LINE Planet Gateway that interfaces between AppServer and LINE Planet internal servers.

Reason 1:1 Call Conference Description
PushError Y N LINE Planet GW failed to call Notify or notify_cb returned a failure.
Please check AppServer or Notify url.
ServerInternalError Y Y Server disconnected a call because of internal error
AuthError Y Y Authentication failure
ReleasedCall Y Y The call was already released.
Ex) Initiator already canceled.
RoomIsFull N Y The number of participants in this room is full
AloneKickOut N Y Server kicks out a user when alone so long time stays in a conference room
NoMediaPacket N Y (Only WebPlanetKit case. from 3.1.6)
WebPlanetKit GW could not receive any media packets
ServiceSLAKeyError Y Y Invalid SLA Key
ServiceInvalidID Y Y Unacceptable character is used in service-id or user-id.
Please refer Terminology.
ServiceMaintenance Y Y Under maintenance
ServiceBusy Y Y LINE Planet GW is busy for the now
ServiceHttpError Y Y Could not HTTP request.
Please check user network environment.
1. Firewall Network firewall settings for LINE Planet
2. Client vaccine program
ServiceInternalError Y Y LINE Planet GW internal error

User defined error

Reason 1:1 Call Conference Description
UserError Y N PlanetKit user(application) disconnected the call with user’s error release code

History

2021-03-04 Add NoPermission and NoMediaPacket case
2020-12-11 Modify description about Delcine for conference case
2020-11-24 Location movement: Article –> API Specification
2020-11-19 The first version
entry.summary: PlanetKit provides kitDisconnectReason for an application to get to know the call disconnection reason.

entry.title: Network firewall settings for LINE Planet

link.title: Network firewall settings for LINE Planet

entry.content:
If an application cannot make it a call or join a conference and disconnected with kitDisconnectReason :: ServiceHttpError, you should check network connection or network firewall settings.

LINE Planet firewall rules

Please refer the following table to check your network firewall.

PlanetKit (iOS, macOS, Android and Windows)

Protocol Source Destination Ports
TCP Any https://voipnx-saturn.line-apps.com
147.92.144.0/24		 443
TCP Any 110.93.154.0/24
110.93.157.0/24
110.93.156.0/24
147.92.179.0/24
147.92.147.0/24
147.92.166.0/24
203.104.162.0/24
203.104.164.0/24		 10001~10020
UDP Any 110.93.154.0/24
110.93.157.0/24
110.93.156.0/24
147.92.179.0/24
147.92.147.0/24
147.92.166.0/24
203.104.162.0/24
203.104.164.0/24		 10001~30000

WebPlanetKit

Protocol Source Destination Ports
TCP Any voipnx-wtp-kr.line-apps.com
223.130.192.0/24		 12000
UDP Any 110.93.157.0/24
110.93.156.0/24		 20000~30000

History

2021-03-04 Apply scale up and WebPlanetKit
2021-02-05 Apply scale up
2020-11-18 The first version
entry.summary: If an application cannot make it a call or join a conference and disconnected with kitDisconnectReason :: ServiceHttpError, you should check network connection or network firewall settings.

entry.title: PlanetKit System Requirements
entry.content:
Contents

1. Operating System Requirements
2. Audio Device Requirements
3. Video Device Requirements
4. Network Requirements

1. Operating System Requirements

Windows macOS iOS Android Web
Windows 7 macOS 10.11 iOS 11.0 Android 5.0
(min SDK 21)		 WebPlanetKit Supported Browser

Android requires Manifest.permission.READ_PHONE_STATE

PlanetKit assumes cellular phone call has more priority than LINE Planet call - both 1:1 call and group call. PlanetKit will end the LINE Planet call when occurs a cellular phone call in the middle of the LINE Planet call. So the android application requires the Manifest.permission.READ_PHONE_STATE permission.

If the application Do Not have the Manifest.permission.READ_PHONE_STATE permission, PlanetKit cannot detect that a cellular phone call occurs or not.

2. Audio Device Requirements

  Windows macOS iOS Android Web
Speaker Mandatory Equipped Equipped Mandatory Option
Microphone Option Option Equipped Option Mandatory
  • Supported speaker
    • Built-in, USB audio device or Bluetooth
  • Supported microphone
    • Built-in, USB audio device or Bluetooth

Permission to access audio device

  Required permission Note
iOS NSMicrophoneUsageDescription key
in your app’s Info.plist file		 Apple Developer
Android Manifest.permission.RECORD_AUDIO Android Developer
macOS NSMicrophoneUsageDescription key
in your app’s Info.plist file		 Apple Developer

3. Video Device Requirements

  Windows macOS iOS Android Web
Camera Option Option Equipped Option Option
Graphic card n/a Metal supported graphic card n/a n/a n/a
  • Supported camera: Built-in or USB webcam

Supported camera image format

  Windows macOS iOS Android
Raw image YUV (I420)
RGB		 YUV (I420, NV12)
RGB		 YUV (I420, NV12)
RGB		 YUV (I420, NV12)
Compressed image MJPEG(from 3.0) Not Support Not Support Not Support

Permission to access camera device

  Required permission Note
iOS NSCameraUsageDescription key
in your app’s Info.plist file		 Apple Developer
Android Manifest.permission.CAMERA Android Developer
macOS NSCameraUsageDescription key
in your app’s Info.plist file		 Apple Developer

Web PlanetKit will shows pop up when need to access camera permission

4. Network Requirements

Network characteristics are not fixed and LINE Planet controls audio and video quality to adapt the network within a call by reasoning network condition.
For example, If there are packet lost, LINE Planet protects media packets by generating FEC packets to keep call quality.
Also if there are speed limitation, LINE Planet lowers the video bitrate to avoid the network congestion.

Following table shows the uni-directional required network speed(kbps) under not lossy networks.

Please note that this is the minimum requirement for a LINE Planet call. LINE Planet drives better call quality in the higher speed network.

1:1 Call

Terminal Network Audio Call Video Call
2G 13 63
3G 20 120
4G 20 120
5G 26 126
WIFI 26 126
Ethernet 26 426

We recommend that try
1:1 video call in the 1.5Mbps/1.5Mbps (up/down) network.

Group Call

Terminal Network Audio Conference (Mixing) Video Conference(SVC)
(For one video stream)
2G 13 113
3G 20 170
4G 20 170
5G 26 176
WIFI 26 176
Ethernet 26 476

The proper speed depends on how many videos are streamed on one client.
For example, we recommend that try
group call in the 2Mbps/2Mbps(Up/Down) network in 4 participants joined video conference.

Presentation

Presentation(Screen share) video is usually HD video resolution.
This requires 1.6Mbps/1.6Mbps (Up/Down) network.
When a presentation is started, the presentation video has higher priority than the camera video. So the camera video resolution could be resized to the smaller resolution.

Video resolution and bandwidth

The video resolution is controlled by the network speed.
The uni-directional minimum network speed(kbps) for each resolution under not lossy networks are following.

Video Call Resolution 1:1 Video Call Video Conference(SVC)
QVGA 50 100
VGA 100 250
HD 1000 1150

History

2021-02-05 The first version

entry.title: Presentation - Screen share
entry.content:
Presentation means a presenter shares his or her screen to show a material such as slides to the other call peer(s).

PlanetKit tries HD video to presentation so the clients should to be under good network. Please check Network Requirements for the detail information.

Presentation life time

A presenter decides when the presentation starts or ends by calling startMyScreenShare() and stopMyScreenShare().

Presenter API Counterpart event Counterpart render API
startMyScreenShare()
Result: compStarted()		 evtPeerScreenShareStarted addPeerScreenShareView()
stopMyScreenShare()
Result: compStopped()		 evtPeerScreenShareStopped removePeerScreenShareView()

Counterpart means a peer in a 1:1 call or participants in a group call.
After being notified by evtPeerScreenShareStarted that a presentation has started, the counterpart must create a view instance and call addPeerScreenShareView() to let PlanetKit render.

Controls by peers

Once a presentation is started, peer or participants will be automatically shared the presentation video. After that if peer or participants hope to pause or resume the presenting video, can use pausePeerScreenShare() or resumePeerScreenShare().

Desktop consideration

A desktop application can choose monitor screen or only application window to share. So the application on Windows and macOS should decide which screen will be shared before calling startMyScreenShare(). PlanetKit provides the available screen list for the application. Please check this via sample codes.

1:1 call

Group call

Reason to stop screen share

When a presenter calls stopMyScreenShare(), it can add a reason that is defined by application requirements. If so, the counter part event evtPeerScreenShareStopped delivers the reason value.
The reason is integer type, so an application should share the definition among multiple platform applications or different application codes.
If do not use reason field, evtPeerScreenShareStopped delivers -1 or FALSE value in the hasReason.

History

2021-02-05 The first version
entry.summary: Presentation means a presenter shares his or her screen to show a material such as slides to the other call peer(s).

entry.title: AppServer Role
entry.content:
To setup a 1:1 call or a group call, AppServer should make a callee(or participants) perceive.

PlanetKit call requires proper information to communicate, so AppServer should to deliver some fields depends on call type.

  • 1:1 Call
  • Group Call

1:1 Call - cc_param

AppServer MUST deliver cc_param to a callee that is copied from param in Notify (notify_cb).

Data from notfy_cb Type Corresponding push payload key
param String cc_param


You can use mobile push system to accomplish this as almost mobile apps do.

Here we assume you use APNs and FCM push system.

Also you can define application’s push data using other fields from notify_cb to handle application requirements such as showing caller’s information or caller’s call type.

Here show examples.
“app_” prefix means defined by application which means they are not required by PlanetKit call setup.

APNs example



GCM/FCM example

Group Call

Unlike 1:1 call, there is no requirements for AppServer to setup a group call.
Just be sure that all participants should share the same service id and conference room id to communicate in the same room.

An application can share them via the application specific channel without involving handling of Group Call Event (on_gcall_evt_cb) depends on an application group call setup flow.

If an application hope to use on_gcall_evt_cb, the service id and room id can be copied from following fields

  • service id: svc_id
  • room id: id

History

2020-12-29 Add description and move location to “Article”
2020-08-07 The first version
entry.summary: To setup a 1:1 call or a group call, AppServer should make a callee(or participants) perceive.

entry.title: Client API Specification
entry.content:
Please check the API reference to get to know how to call PlanetKit APIs in detail.

Platform API Reference Note
iOS iOS API Reference  
Android Android API Reference Deployment via Linecorp Maven
macOS macOS API Reference  
Windows Please check header declaration  
Web WebPlanetKit API Reference Please check API Reference to show supported browser information.

Required environment including the minimum supportable OS can be shown in System Requirements.

History

entry.title: Information to send push notifications
entry.content:
Common

Service ID

iOS: APNs

  • Apple Push Notification service SSL (Sandbox & Production) certificate for your application.
    1. Create certificate for your sample app
    2. Generate .p12 file from the certificate
    3. Send the .p12 file and its password to us

Please make sure that the push certificate MUST be the same with the build certificate.

Android and Web: FCM

  • Server key and Sender ID
    1. Login to your Firebase console https://console.firebase.google.com/ and select your Firebase project
    2. Go to Setting > Project Setting > Cloud messaging

History

2020-11-30 Add Sample
2020-08-11 The first version
